creator: shealynn anderson
title: How To Make Paper Circuits
materials_required: Print out of a paper circuit template
description: This project explains how to create a simple paper circuit that lights up an LED using copper tape, batteries, and a paper template.
steps: Lay copper tape on the template to determine the optimal size, aiming to minimize cuts by folding at corners for direction changes.
Cut the copper tape to the determined size.
Remove the backing and carefully place the copper tape on the template's outline, ensuring it's smooth and flat, especially at folded corners.
Repeat the process until all copper tape sections are applied, including the 'switch' area in the bottom left corner.
Bend the LED light's legs outwards, noting that the longer leg is positive and the shorter leg is negative.
Place the LED light in the designated spot on the template, folding the copper tape over its legs, ensuring correct polarity and secure contact.
Position one battery with its positive side facing down within the outlined circle for the positive battery.
Place the second battery with its negative side facing down within its designated circle.
Fold the paper corner with the positive battery over, so both batteries are touching, adjusting their position as needed.
Fold the corner with the copper tape 'switch' to bridge the circuit gap, aligning the tape ends with the circuit.
With the circuit complete, folding the batteries and switch should illuminate the LED light.
